column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Took this for most of my pregnancy and now that I'm breast feeding. Love that this does not contain DHA, because I have problems with Lipase in my milk.  Easy to use, and I don't have any side effects.

column9: Other prenatal vitamins were making me extremely nauseous, I have been on this one now for 4 weeks and have not had any problems with nausea.

column9: I am about 15 weeks pregnant with no problems with Prefera OB. I take it at night and sometimes become gassy, but no problems yet.

column2: StacieC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm now 17 weeks, and I was taken another type of prenatal vitamins and I was always nausea. I switched to Prefera OB, and I'm very satified with the outcome!!!

column2: Babyme, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 11 weeks pregnant and started taking Prefera at 6 weeks when I went for my first OB visit.  I chose to take it at night because it's easier for me to remember at dinner.  I have had nights of waking up very nauseas and gassy.  When I take it in the morning, I'm fine, but still chose to take it at night for memory purposes.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: I love this vitamin because it doesn't upset my stomach. I was on another brand before that was really hard to tolerate during my first trimester. I switched to Prefera OB and I haven't had any nausea or stomach upset related to the vitamins. Great!

column2: abc, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was having problems with the iron in the prenatals, but with Prefera ob which has a unique natural iron I have had no issues with taking this small effective Prenatal.
